{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3602192,"name":"Ömer Faruk Uçar","username":"Yavuz_Cetin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/y/ac91a4/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-24T07:34:06.019Z","cooked":"

Greetings

We have been having a problem with our robot for a while. It will be a long narration.

When we finished the robot, we had no problem getting the offset of the cancoders. But when we started driving, the power suddenly went out. When we turned the robot back on, all Sparks except 1 Spark (the Spark closest to PDH) started to glow cyan and orange (Gate Drive Fault). Also PDH’s status LED started blinking magenta (Keep Alive Timeout). Somehow we solved the problem with the Sparks, but PDH is still flashing magenta.

I hope you understand the end. It was a bit long. Can you help me?

So just to clarify, does everything run now? I’m guessing there was a very bad short that caused that

But does the hardware work?

Magenta blinking doesn’t look like a hardware issue, just can Power Distribution Hub Status LED Patterns | ION Control System

Yavuz_Cetin:

But when we started driving, the power suddenly went out.

Do you know why the robot lost power? Is that issue resolved?

The robot lost power three times. We know why the first time. The battery + cable was disconnected from the PDH. But we have no idea about the others.

this sounds like it could be an issue with your CAN bus that’s flaring up whenever theres some shock on the robot (such as driving), have you checked across your bus that the wires and connections are all good? especially something like a frayed wire or loose connector.
